article:
A 'trap primer' (or 'trap seal primer') is a plumbing device or valve that adds
water to traps. The water seals in traps are needed to prevent sewer gases from
entering buildings, but because this water is exposed to the air, it is subject
to evaporation over time in infrequently used floor drains, leading to the
release of sewer gas into the environment. The trap primer mitigates this
problem by injecting water, either directly or indirectly, into the trap to
maintain the water seal indefinitely.

Building codes may require trap primers for some traps, especially for where
experience has shown that there are isolated and/or infrequently used drains
such as basement floor drains (which are only used when the basement is
flooded). Where explosion hazards are high, specifying trap primers, whether
required or not by code, is wise. Trap primers do require maintenance and
replacement, so they should be installed in accessible locations.
